name: interrogator
content:

a person who asks someone a lot of questions for a long time in order to get information, and who sometimes uses threats or violence: aggressive tactics used by some military interrogators He told his interrogators only what they wanted to hear. See
interrogate
More examplesFewer examplesThey allege that police interrogators ignored or refused their requests for a lawyer. Interrogators have questioned the eight people detained last weekend.He was tortured by interrogators who accused him of being a member of the rebel group.
